html:
Best Cooling

Omorovicza Cooling Dermaglobes

These water-filled glass globes are designed to be cooled in a refrigerator before use. Once you’re ready, take them out and roll them across the skin; they’ll feel as cool and refreshing as an ice cube but not nearly as messy or painful. Afterward, your skin will feel tighter, firmer, and less puffy overall.

Material: Glass

Omorovicza rating: 5/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “I will admit that I am not one of those people who wakes up every morning with flawless skin. My day usually starts with my skin feeling a bit dehydrated and puffy, which is why I’ve tailored my skincare routine to be soothing and moisturizing. These orbs from Omorovicza feel cool on the skin to help ease any puffiness or irritation. Using these globes is also a relaxing way to start and end your day, like a quick at-home spa treatment.”—Tasha Smith, ELLE beauty assistant

Best High-Tech Roller

TheraBody TheraFace Depuffing Wand

Pros
  • Comes with a 1-year warranty
  • Six temperature settings
Cons
  • There is a bit of a learning curve

Looking for something that’ll really pack a punch? This device may have a higher price tag, but its features and technologies are worth the investment. The gadget provides both cold and heat therapies to banish puffiness within minutes, and you’ll find that the contoured tip fits perfectly beneath your eyes for the most comfortable experience.

Material: Copper/aluminum alloy

Sephora rating: 4.7/5 stars

A Sephora reviewer says: “Pleasantly surprised by the results of this product. I used both hot and cold therapy, and both seemed to be effective. I would recommend this wand to anyone looking to reduce puffiness and dark circles under the eyes. After a few uses, I already noticed a visual improvement in my complexion.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Rose Quartz Roller

Sephora Collection Rose Quartz Facial Roller

Pros
  • Cooling even without refrigeration

Sephora’s in-house beauty brand is a true sleeper hit. You’d be surprised at how many affordable gems are hidden in that section of your local Sephora. One of those is this rose quartz facial roller, which has a smaller stone for reducing puffiness and a bigger one for massaging your face and body. It looks gorgeous and feels fantastic, especially after a late night out.

Material: Rose quartz

Sephora rating: 4.8/5 stars

A Sephora reviewer says: “After using it this week, I’m surprised that it got rid of all my puffiness under my eyes. I have dark circles, and it really helps my dark circles and skin.”

Best Metal Roller

Beauty Pie Sculpting Facial Roller

Pros
  • Can be used all over the face
Cons
  • May be a little heavy for some

If you look carefully at this facial roller, you’ll see a series of small grooves; according to the brand, they enhance the tool’s sculpting and massaging abilities, leading to things like a sharper-looking jawline and a perfectly smooth under-eye. The roller feels weighty and luxurious in the hand and likely will last you for years with proper care.

Materials: Zinc, aluminum

Beauty Pie rating: 4.8/5 stars

A Beauty Pie reviewer says: “This is a beautiful facial tool. It’s substantial and feels so well made. I’m not expecting miracles, but on early mornings when I look tired, a minute of rolling seems to help lessen my under eye puffiness.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Celebrity Brand

Keys Soulcare Obsidian Facial Roller

Cons
  • Handle may feel too light

One of superstar Alicia Keys’s favorite tools to use in the morning is this obsidian facial roller. The stone always feels cool to the touch, and the device promises to improve skin texture as it soothes irritation and puffiness.

Material: Obsidian

Amazon rating: 4.8/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I recently tried out the Keys Soulcare Obsidian Facial Roller, and while I can’t say for sure if it actually revitalized my skin, I can say that it feels absolutely amazing to use. I followed the recommended usage instructions, but I found that the roller was particularly helpful in relieving tension along my jawline and temples when I had a headache. Additionally, it worked wonders in reducing puffiness and tiredness around my eyes.”

Best Multi-Purpose

Kitsch Facial Lifting Roller

Pros
  • Relatively affordable
  • Portable
Cons
  • May be too tight for some

“This Kitsch ice roller is also a facial massager,” says Dr. Patel. Indeed, one end of the tool has a beaded massager, to sculpt and relieve tension in your jawline as well as your neck. The other side has a stainless steel eye and face roller to cool and depuff any areas that need some TLC.

Material: Stainless steel

Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I saw an influencer post this as a face ‘lifting” tool,’ but I purchased it for sinus pressure and pain. This thing is amazing. I roll on the jawline as well as sinuses on either side of the nose. It helps with pressure during allergy season and puffiness from Hashimoto’s disease (thyroid disease). I store it in a Ziplock bag in my freezer after cleaning with an alcohol pad. The small end is great for mornings [when] I have to do my makeup but haven’t slept enough. Drains the puffiness from my eyes.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Meet the Expert

How do you use eye rollers?

According to Dr. Patel, you should always use eye rollers after washing your face. “Also, a cooled roller is more helpful,” she adds. “Start at the inner corners of your eyes and roll outward toward your cheeks.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

How often can you use eye rollers?

“It is safe to use eye rollers daily,” says Dr. Patel. Whip them out in the morning to de-puff and help you wake up or use them in the evening to help you de-stress.
